history.content:
Don't bother taking Math 54, it's not even required for EECS and EE16A/B prepare you much better for upperdivs in EECS. Also 7B and 7A share roughly the same workload, the only game changer is how much previous experience you have with mechanics vs E&M and Thermodynamics. The E&M part of 7B is also quite calculus intensive compared to 7A so most people will find it probably find 7B more difficult.. If you feel comfortable with those topics then 7B will be okay. Additionally, if you are veering towards being CS-focused I would honestly consider putting 7B off till senior year altogether. :) 

Also CS70 homework sets take at least about 10-15 hours per week for most people to do/understand well, so you're looking at a pretty heavy workload probably even more than the one you're taking right now. So I would suggest removing 7B/replacing it with something easier.

children.subject: I'm the Student who created this post. Instead of Physics 7B, what other practical technical class should I take that would help me with UD CS? I was thinking of Stat 134: for the probability part of cs70 and since it could possibly help with EE126

history.content:
If you're an EECS major, then definitely finish taking 16AB before thinking about whether you need more linear algebra, and which course you might want to take to do that.

You shouldn't take Stat 134. Take 126 after you have taken 70. 

Nothing says you have to take 3 technical courses. If 3 isn't working well for you this term, drop back down to 2. If you want to do something technical without the full load of taking a course, try to volunteer to be course staff in say 16A or another lower-div that you've taken. This gives you a way to both help others while improving your technical understanding of the material.

Hello, Second year EECS major here. How do the classes above look like for next semester? I was advised not to take math 54 in place of 7B since both CS70 and 16A/B are as good as taking 54. But my concern is that I won't be able to truly learn from these classes (especially cs70) given this workload. I'm having a rough time right now with 7A, 16A, 61C, mainly because all of my assignments/homeworks are due the same day. I heard 7B is less intense than 7A, but that 16B was harder than 16A given the project debugging.

So should I stay with 7B or switch to 54 to have more time for 70? ANY feedback is appreciated. For reference: I'm done with my HSS, and interested in Security.
history.subject: CS70 + EE16B + Physics 7B
